messages.content: Tell me about a famous epileptic from history

One famous epileptic from history was Julius Caesar, who was known to have seizures. He was believed to have had a form of temporal lobe epilepsy, which is caused by abnormal electrical activity in the brain.
What other causes of their symptoms are hypothesised?
Other possible causes of his symptoms include a stroke, an injury from a Gladiator battle, or a brain tumor.
